- CSV (comma delimited) - All values double quoted, even headers - Dates in date time format - Check data for spelling errors & missing or impossible values - Open CSV in notepad (or any plain text editor) to check data is correctly formatted ### General - files are deleted from our FTP after 14 days (but all files are still recorded in Lucid) - do not upload zipped files - do not create/upload to subfolders - refresh window looks back 10 days to find new audio posted. - preferably, meta should be uploaded Just after the audio, but it MUST be uploaded within the refresh window in order for Lucid to properly display data in the UI. ### Audio - audio should be .wav or .mp3 - for best performance we recommend not compressing the audio to < 128 kbps - filenames must be unique - if filenames contain metadata they should all follow the same format - do not alter audio filenames ### Meta Lucid includes the capability to associate various metadata categories with each call. Metadata should support as many fields as possible and a definition of those that are not self-explanatory should be provided. Examples: Call Center, Product/Brand, Agent Name, Customer Name, Address, Customer Ani, Order Status, Disposition, etc. This data can be provided via an associated .csv file or provided within the audio filenames. **If provided via audio filenames:** - Direction on file naming convention where Ignite will extract that information. - As an example: file name may be "product_agentName_orderStatus_disposition_date.mp3" - filenames must be unique **If provided via .csv file:** - file should be posted to the SFTP site (same as audio files) - filenames must be unique - meta filenames must match 1:1 with audio filenames - all values (and headers) must be double quoted - headers should not contain any whitespace or special characters (/'!-,>...etc) - sep = ',' - EOL = line break / new line - metadata is mapped into lucid via column number, so do not alter column order (additional columns should be added to the end) - date values must be formatted as date time – “5/7/2021 12:00:00” (use military time to avoid adding AM/PM) - adding an agent ID number instead of agent name will help mitigate any ambiguity that may arise from different agent name spellings ## Examples - diagrams - good (and bad) sample data ```{mermaid} %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'useMaxWidth': 'false', 'themeVariables': { 'background': '#FAFAF5', 'primaryColor': '#EAEAD6', 'nodeBorder': '#8B814C', 'lineColor': '#8B814C', 'primaryTextColor': '#191970', 'textColor': '#191970', 'fontSize': '12px', 'secondaryColor': '#FAFAF5'}}}%% flowchart LR A>filename]:::name -- " criteria " --> B[must be unique
